intro: Maxillaria podochila, commonly known as the pink lady orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is a terrestrial orchid with a pseudobulb and produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and blooms during the warmer months. It thrives in humid, well-drained environments and requires moderate light for optimal growth. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts.
